original_solution_mapping.L1: One-tenth of the time, no one reappears, so there have been 100 / 10 = <<100/10=10>>10 times no one has reappeared.
original_solution_mapping.L2: One-fifth of the time, two people reappear, so there have been 100 / 5 = <<100/5=20>>20 times 2 people have reappeared.
original_solution_mapping.L3: In those 20 times, 2 * 20 = <<2*20=40>>40 people have reappeared in all.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Thus, there have been 100 - 10 - 20 = <<100-10-20=70>>70 times one person has reappeared.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Therefore, over 100 acts, 70 + 40 = 100 people have reappeared in all.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6157.
    Returns: the total number of people who have reappeared.
    """
    # L1
    total_performances = 100 # 100 performances of the act this year
    no_reappear_divisor = 10 # one-tenth of the time
    times_no_reappear = total_performances / no_reappear_divisor

    # L2
    two_people_reappear_divisor = 5 # one-fifth of the time
    times_two_reappear = total_performances / two_people_reappear_divisor

    # L3
    people_per_two_reappear_event = 2 # two people reappear
    people_from_two_reappear_events = people_per_two_reappear_event * times_two_reappear

    # L4
    times_one_reappear = total_performances - times_no_reappear - times_two_reappear

    # L5
    total_people_reappeared = times_one_reappear + people_from_two_reappear_events

    # FA
    answer = total_people_reappeared
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: One-tenth of the time, no one reappears, so there have been {total_performances} / {no_reappear_divisor} = <<{total_performances}/{no_reappear_divisor}={times_no_reappear}>>{times_no_reappear} times no one has reappeared.

One-fifth of the time, two people reappear, so there have been {total_performances} / {two_people_reappear_divisor} = <<{total_performances}/{two_people_reappear_divisor}={times_two_reappear}>>{times_two_reappear} times 2 people have reappeared.

In those {times_two_reappear} times, {people_per_two_reappear_event} * {times_two_reappear} = <<{people_per_two_reappear_event}*{times_two_reappear}={people_from_two_reappear_events}>>{people_from_two_reappear_events} people have reappeared in all.

Thus, there have been {total_performances} - {times_no_reappear} - {times_two_reappear} = <<{total_performances}-{times_no_reappear}-{times_two_reappear}={times_one_reappear}>>{times_one_reappear} times one person has reappeared.
Therefore, over {total_performances} acts, {times_one_reappear} + {people_from_two_reappear_events} = {total_people_reappeared} people have reappeared in all.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: One-fifth of the time, two people reappear, so there have been 100 / 5 = <<100/5=20>>20 times 2 people have reappeared.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: In those 20 times, 2 * 20 = <<2*20=40>>40 people have reappeared in all.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Thus, there have been 100 - 10 - 20 = <<100-10-20=70>>70 times one person has reappeared.

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'times_one_reappear' (value: 70.0) was reported instead of 'total_people_reappeared' (value: 110.0).
